main event: A stationary aerial object was observed near Craig, Montana on January 9, 1953 that suddenly accelerated and disappeared.
interesting points: The object appeared to be stationary, then suddenly accelerated and disappeared, which is characteristic of unidentified aerial phenomena.
The object was described as 25 to 40 feet long, 5 feet thick, and had the appearance of two soup bowls put together with glowing, pulsating lights.
The object was observed at a distance of 10 to 15 feet and was estimated to be 200 to 300 yards away.
An investigation revealed the observers were mature, reliable, and at least one was relatively experienced.
A separate sighting by a witness driving near Glasgow, Montana described a silver, saucer-shaped object that flashed a bright light and climbed rapidly out of sight, estimated at 5,600 mph.
sighted object: elongated, cigar-shaped object with a tapered end and glowing, pulsating lights
photographs: yes, the report includes a photograph of the UFO
